original_title: Failure to prevent violence after May 9: Writ petition against Shavendra, IGP and others withdrawn
original_body_lines: A writ petition filed by 22 government Parliamentarians representing the SLPP and several others against former Army Commander General Shavendra Silva, IGP C.D. Wickremaratne and others for their alleged failure to prevent violence following the attack on Galle Face protesters on May 9, 2022 was withdrawn today by the petitioners themselves before the Court of Appeal.
The petitioners decided to withdraw their application subsequent to an undertaking given by the Minister of Public Security that a comprehensive investigation will be held regarding the incident.
Accordingly, President's Counsel Sanjeeva Jayawardena, appearing for the petitioners, sought court's permission to withdraw the petition. (Lakmal Sooriyagoda)
